Others: Cleveland Guardians clinched one of the American League's six playoff spots with a 3-2 win over the Minnesota Twins.
Led by their 39-year-old rookie manager, Stephen Vogt, and a devastating bullpen, the Guardians secured their place in the playoffs.
The Guardians' 42nd comeback of the season is noted as a significant achievement.
The team's aggressive style of play, known as 'Guards ball', has contributed to their success.
Cleveland's bullpen, particularly All-Star closer Emmanuel Clase, has been a key factor in their success.
